page.title: 20Occupations
page.content: 100 years ago most people worked in the village or on the farms around. They included stonemasons, sawyers, smiths, tanners, shopkeepers etc. Today, most people find employment out of the village either in Corby or Kettering. Up until 1980 scores of men in the village were employed by {British Steel}at Corby, now only a handful still have jobs there. The chief source of employment in the village is{Spencers Woodyard.}The {Wallis and Linnells building}is no longer a clothing factory but houses a firm of chartered architects. This factory was built in 1872 at a cost of Â£1,334 2s. 7d. The factory closed on 23rd November 1979.
